snippet: Although soda and sugary drinks are obvious targets for public health campaigns, they make up on average a third of the calories from added sugars that Americans consume in a typical day – a significant amount, but not the lion’s share.
abstract: Although soda and sugary drinks are obvious targets for public health campaigns, they make up on average a third of the calories from added sugars that Americans consume in a typical day – a significant amount, but not the lion’s share.

headline.main: Really? Most of the Added Sugar in Our Diets Comes From Sugary Drinks
headline.print_headline: The Claim: Most of the added sugar in our diets comes from sugary drinks.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
